content.description: This route shares the start for Bop 'Till You Drop and then heads left after the third bolt.  You can stay on the left side of the arete or climb the left face.

This enjoyable line runs through very large nubbins (including one the size of a baseball) then switches over to small angled ledges and pockets running over a bulge or two. Using good feet will make this route feel easier than the grade.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Anchors on shared ledge with "Red Scare".
content.location: The right most bolt line on the lower Pleasure Palace wall.

content.description: This route would probably be my last choice of climbs at Pleasure Palace. The start is a little interesting with a few thought provoking moves up a right leaning seam that peters out to mediocre face moves. This all leads up to the perfect ending of reaching up to a giant jug full of a huge pile of bird droppings. Mantle this and clip the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts. Anchors at top. you won't be able to see the anchors from the base but the're there. You might wish they weren't though. Rap.
content.location: The left most line of bolts on the lower Pleasure Palace wall.

content.description: This route has fairly forgettable moves but makes for a good warm up if your working the harder routes on the wall. lichen covers the upper section but constant traffic keeps the lichen of the hand and footholds. Keep moving upward and the bolts and anchors will appear. crux is after the third bolt.
content.location: the face to the right of Aggro Bumbly.

content.description:
In the lower section of The Pleasure Palace this fun face makes for a good warm up on a hot summer morning. 

  This is the right most of the routes in the lower section, it is the first area of decent looking rock uphill from Mesa Verde. 

  Follow face holds through a series of smallbulges to a bolted anchor.
content.location: The lower tier of the Pleasure Palace, the right most of three bolted routes.

content.description: This route is a one-sequence wonder that could be considered a bolted boulder problem.  Easy moves lead to a tricky sequence pulling around a bulge on big holds.  After this, easy arete moves lead to an anchor.  Enjoyable moves but the brief difficulties are all over 1/3rd of the way up.
content.protection: five bolts, and the anchor at the top is hangers only (no rings or chains).
content.location: Middle of Upper Pleasure Palace Wall, just left of Bop Till You Drop.

content.description:
4 Bolts. Just right of a clean arete rises a short, strenuous route on a blocky rock. Expect nothing special 

  -Alan Watts from Rock Climbing Smith Rock State Park
Jug Fest!   Follow great holds up a steep arete on excellent rock. The pump builds 2/3 of the way up but the holds stay good till the top.
content.location: Between Matthew 7:24 and Little Wicked Thing near the top of the ridge.

content.description: Start in a corner and head up on edges leading to thin horizontal pockets.  The crux hits mid-way, with strenuous reaches between pockets.
content.location: Far left route on the Upper Pleasure Palace wall.

content.description: A handful of good sport climbs are to be found in the Pleasure Palace. It's in the shade in the morning and stays cool on hot days. Bop Till you Drop is the primo route but the others are also worth climbing.
